intro: Paraboea yunfuensis, commonly known as the Yunfu paraboea, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically followed by small, berry-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
